citations.narrative:
The enclosure for the Great Horned Owl had a 6 inch long and 4 inch wide hole in the wire enclosure causing sharp
points and an area where the bird could put it's head through. The enclosure also had a second 6 inch long and 4 inch
wide hole that had a partial repair with wire and zip ties placed over it. The repaired wire appeared to be pushed down
which caused the hole to be exposed again.
The net that makes up the roof of the enclosure for the American White Pelicans was found to have an opening about 12
inch long and 6 inch wide. Numerous wild Crows were seen flying in the enclosure. Wild birds can introduce pathogens
and disease to the facility's flock and the primary enclosure needs to be built to prevent other animals from entering. The
primary enclosure must restrict other animals from entering the enclosure.
Correct by March 22, 2026
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Patricia Laracuente, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The enclosure for the Great Horned Owl had a 6 inch long and 4 inch wide hole in the wire enclosure causing sharp 
points and an area where the bird could put it's head through. The enclosure also had a second 6 inch long and 4 inch 
wide hole that had a partial repair with wire and zip ties placed over it. The repaired wire appeared to be pushed down 
which caused the hole to be exposed again.  
 
The net that makes up the roof of the enclosure for the American White Pelicans was found to have an opening about 12 
inch long and 6 inch wide. Numerous wild Crows were seen flying in the enclosure. Wild birds can introduce pathogens 
and disease to the facility's flock and the primary enclosure needs to be built to prevent other animals from entering. The 
primary enclosure must restrict other animals from entering the enclosure. 
 
Correct by March 22, 2026 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Patricia Laracuente, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: BARN OWL / WESTERN BARN OWL / AMERICAN BARN OWL /
